embed.description: Continue reading for more information! Lissandra now has an updated biography and short story on her Universe page! "In a time long forgotten, before the sands birthed and then swallowed Shurima, beings of old magic freely walked Runeterra. The borders between the mortal realm and what lay beyond it were hotly contested.

replies.body:
I honestly liked this new lore update. The Frostguard story was a good read and Lissandra’s new lore is refreshing for the most part.
Vel’koz is my main, and saying that I am satisfied with his new lore.
However I am a little sad he is more akin to a pawn though, but for those who think the same, keep in mind Vel’koz is basically one of the oldest (if not the oldest) Voidborn. To me it seems like Vel’koz is a Witch King like figure where the Watchers are Sauron (Lord of the Rings reference). Vel’koz is the herald of the invasion and might be a commander of sorts for the lesser Voidborn when the time comes for an invasion. Vel’koz is in control, he just serves a higher power.

Thanks Riot for the new lore! The Void is just so interesting of a place, and ever since I started playing League I have been curious about it.

Saying that vel is a pawn is probably understating him a bit, he might have started out as one but do consider, by now he has been alive for thousands if not tens of thousands of years.

Its like a pawn reaching the other side of the board and promoting to a queen.

He is the oldest, smartest, most cunning and experienced voidborn in the world, to the watchers he is probably their plan B if they cant get through Lissandra.
I love the Pawn ---> Queen analogy. That's perfect!

Scathlocke, sorry for butting in on your conversation with someone else, but I need clarification about Lissandra's bio.

I'm a little confused where she stands in terms of her allegiances. Was she serving the Watchers and then betrayed them after realizing their power? Does she still have plans for Freljord/world domination? Does she still put on a human guise? Is she still villainous? Is she still the Ice Witch?

Sorry again, but the wording of the Lissandra bio confused me and I just want clarification.

1. pretending to serve them-- actually trying to keep them contained. Fortunately for her, the watcher's concept of time is different that ours.  (billions and billions of years)
2. yes.
3. yes. 
4. yes.  But she's not stupid or suicidal. (If she was to allow the Watchers into our world she knows she too would die.)
5. yes.  She is an iceborn and a witch.

Thank you so much! This actually helped me understand her new lore more... I habe a few questions on my thread feel free to help out if you can :)
Why is Lissandra blue? I always believed it was because of being an iceborn, but if Ashe and Sejuani are considered members, then what’s different about her?
So, if I'm to understand correctly, the Watchers aren't directly aligned with the void, although they came from it?

Unless I'm misinterpreting it, the Watchers basically **are** the Void, it seems. The Void is just the dimension they "exist" in.

They made the Voidborn to carry out their tasks. Everything Void-related seems to come directly from them.
I read it as the Frozen Watchers were the first Void dudes to come over, but they failed (for now) and because of that the rest of the Void dudes are just kind of avoiding the Freljord.
That and also in Freljord they still use Fahrenheit so it's hard to guess when you're dead and when you'e fine If you come from another dimension that uses something more normal, like Celsius.

Vel'Koz: Basically the same, with some elaboration. Definitely a step up. Good job!

Lissandra: She's more of an anti-hero now, given that it was she who froze the Watchers in the first place. She's trying to kill all who may discover her former allegiance to the Watchers, but she's trying to stop the end of Runeterra as well. Not sure where she stands. But I kind of like it.

The Watchers and Voidborn are also technically anti-heroes now.
They just basically have migraine because of mortal world and are merely trying to stop the pain.
Poor guys.

I'm not understanding how Lissandra's actions and motivations match. She eventually turned on the Watchers and sealed them, but had to turn on her sisters to do it? Why? They all wanted to banish/eliminate the Watchers. Also, what is the point of rewriting history, eliminating "rival" Iceborn, or pitting the modern day Iceborn and their forces against each other, when it only weakens them? ( I haven't read her short story yet, maybe that will explain it)

Vel'Koz is awesome. So much lore for the Void.

She probably realized she was in over her head. The Watchers' only goal is the annihilation of all existence. Lissandra wants to rule the Freljord or the world, and since it's impossible to support the Void's cause unless you're insane, suicidal or Voidborn, she tricked them into giving her power before turning on them and her sisters to secure her position.

She's not getting away with it, obviously.

I haven't read the short story for Lissandra yet, but its def a bit of a retcon for her. Instead of there being some war between her and her sisters to stop the watchers, Lissandra chooses to stop the watchers herself. 

Which doesn't make a lot of sense since she sacrificed her sisters to stop the watchers, but she only opposed the watchers because her sisters wanted her to

It seems like Lissandra tried to play both sides and ended up the winner, albeit temporarily.

I'm not sure the Watchers appreciate being double-crossed, and she probably knows this. We'll see if she can find a permanent solution to them.
Kinda hard to see where she aligns herself now. She doesn't seem like she's tryin to free the watchers but she still pledges servitude to them

That's the most confusing part of her bio:

>Now, they wandered through Lissandra’s dreams as easily as she had theirs, and always she would wake, terrified, professing her loyalty to the chilling eternity they promised.

Is she doing it instinctively out of fear? Is she foolishly trying to convince the Watchers and/or herself that she's been loyal to them?
Seems like a fear reaction, like she's being tortured or something and is hoping that saying she's still loyal will stop the pain? I am also confused by this.
Yeah I was confused by this when Ornn was first released.

Two of my favorite heroes. Hell yes.

Vel'Koz, holy shit. He's pretty good.

He just got two steps scarier, he is like the one ryze saw but its great ancestor.''

Sticking his "probe" into peoples skulls and "poking" around? holy moly that sent shivers up my spine.

I don't like Lissandra's new bio. It's very confusing, both because of how poorly written it is and because of the contradicting information it relays.
I'm also left unsatisfied by the worrying amount of retcons in the post-Institute of War lore: all the information we currently have feels ultimately volatile and insignificant, since any part of it could suddenly stop being canon once the narrative team writes itself into a corner again.
I'm sorry to say that, but I'm extremely disappointed.

I don't understand Lissandra's relationship with the Watchers. She's against them, but also her nation?
She doesn't want people to find out about her former alliance with them. She is now trying to keep them trapped.

Seems lissandra bargained with them for power but didnt understand just what they were and when the time came to pay her debts she decided to flip the table instead.

By using all her friends, sisters and servants as catalysts for a ritual to create a freeze the void rift in a true ice glacier. 

Now she is apparently trying to boost that glacial barrier by gathering more true ice because the watchers are eroding it.

Its also unclear why she is trying to kill people off, seems a bit random.
